comment.author: 24246880@N07
comment._content:
The famous Reederei Laeitsz successfully operated the" Parma" in the nitrate trade from Hamburg round the Horn to South America. The names of all their excellent world wide trading  full-riggers and barques began with "P" such as" Passat", still to be seen in Travemunde, and the 1927 Geestemünde built "Padua" now "Krusenstern" still sailing under the Russian flag. Enthusiasts can sail aboard as trainees.
Many of the "flying P" sailers were sold on to  Gustav Eriksson of Mariehamm who put them into the grain trade Australia to Europe
The big "Pommern" can still be admired in Mariehamm.

All the best

Lucinda
